{{Infobox comedian | name = Jeff Dye | image = Jeff Dye in November 2016.jpg | caption = Dye on November 6, 2016 | birth_name = Jeffrey Dye | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | body_discovered = | resting_place = | medium = | nationality = [[United States|American]] | active = 2007-present | genre = | subject = | influences = | influenced = | spouse = | domestic_partner = | notable_work = ''[[Money From Strangers]]''
''[[Girl Code]]''
''[[List of Comedy Central Presents episodes|Comedy Central Presents Jeff Dye]]''
''[[Comic-Con All Access 2014]]''
'' [[Extreme Makeover: Home Edition]]'' [[Better Late Than Never (TV series)]] | signature = | website = {{official website|http://www.jeffdye.com}} | footnotes = | current_members = | past_members = | module = |}} '''Jeffrey''' "'''Jeff'''" '''Dye''' is an [[United States|American]] stand-up comedian & actor. ==Career== Dye has hosted two series for [[MTV]]—''Numbnuts'' and ''Money From Strangers'' and also appeared on ''Girl Code''. He was a finalist on the sixth season of the [[NBC]] series ''[[Last Comic Standing 6|Last Comic Standing]]'', finishing third behind Marcus and winner [[Iliza Shlesinger]], and then performed in a 50-city tour with the other top competitors.{{cite web|last=Roper|first=Chase|title=Jeff Dye: Plays well with others|url=http://www.laughspin.com/2010/05/04/jeff-dye-plays-well-with-others/|work=Laughspin|accessdate=2 November 2013|date=4 May 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131104042401/http://www.laughspin.com/2010/05/04/jeff-dye-plays-well-with-others/|archivedate=4 November 2013|df=}} Dye performed at the [[TBS (U.S. TV channel)|TBS]] Comedy Festival in Chicago and ''[[Live at Gotham|Comedy Central's Live At Gotham]]'' before starring in his own half-hour comedy special titled ''[[List of Comedy Central Presents episodes|Comedy Central Presents Jeff Dye]]'' in 2010. As of 2011, Dye was a recurring cast member on [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC's]] show ''[[Extreme Makeover: Home Edition]]''.{{cite web|title=Pike Wire Interview: Jeff Dye|url=http://piketowncenter.com/2011/06/pike-wire-interview-jeff-dye/|work=Pike Towncenter|date=1 June 2011}} Dye was the host of ''MTV's Club New Year's Eve 2013 Live'' from Time's Square.{{cite web|title=Ke$ha, Sean Kingston, Others Ring In New Year 2013|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1699522/kesha-ne-yo-new-years-eve-mtv/|work=MTV|date=1 January 2013}} Dye can be seen as the lead in [[Dierks Bentley]]'s award-winning music video, ''[[Drunk on a Plane]]''.{{cite web|title=Dierks Bentley's 'Drunk on a Plane' Violates Numerous FAA Rules|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/dierks-bentley-drunk-on-a-plane-video/|work=Taste of Country|date=12 May 2014}} Dye was a correspondent for [[Spike TV]]'s ''Comic-Con All Access 2014''.{{cite web|title=Spike TV’s "Comic-Con All Access" To Be Programmed and Controlled by Fans via Social Media|url=http://www.spike.com/press/2014/07/22/spike-tvs-comic-con-all-access-2014/|work=Spike TV|date=22 July 2014}} In January 2015, he supported the Seattle Seahawks for [[ESPN]]'s ''Enemy Territory''.{{cite web|title=Front & Center: Comedian Gary Gulman on SportsCenter’s "Enemy Territory"|url=http://www.espnfrontrow.com/2015/01/front-center-comedian-gary-gulman-sportscenters-enemy-territory/|work=ESPN|date=17 January 2015}} Dye was also a recurring celebrity cast member on [[NBC]]'s game show ''[[I Can Do That (U.S. TV series)|I Can Do That]]'' which aired during the summer of 2015.{{Cite web |url= https://variety.com/2015/tv/news/nbc-gives-series-order-to-celebrity-variety-show-i-can-do-that-1201445114/ |title= NBC Gives Series Order to Celebrity Variety Show ‘I Can Do That’ |first=Cynthia |last=Littleton |date= 3 March 2015 |accessdate= 17 March 2015 |website = Variety |quote = The six regulars set for the competition are “Dancing With the Stars” alum Cheryl Burke; singers Joe Jonas, Nicole Scherzinger and Ciara; comedian Jeff Dye; and actor Alan Ritchson. }} Dye appeared on [[Ken Reid (comedian)|Ken Reid]]'s ''TV Guidance Counselor'' podcast on September 16, 2015. He was on the 2016 reality show ''[[Better Late Than Never (TV series)|Better Late Than Never]]'' as the tour organizer and suitcase holder for [[William Shatner]], [[Terry Bradshaw]], [[George Foreman]] and [[Henry Winkler]] while they toured Asia.{{cite web|url=http://www.spokesman.com/stories/2017/dec/29/bradshaw-foreman-winkler-shatner-bond-on-european-/#/0|title=Bradshaw, Foreman, Winkler, Shatner bond on European TV trip|publisher=}} Dye returned to ''[[Better Late Than Never (TV series)|Better Late Than Never]]'' in 2017-2018 alongside Shatner, Bradshaw, Foreman and Winkler as "The Sidekick" while they toured Europe and Morocco. ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== *{{imdb name|3273910}} {{US-actor-stub}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dye, Jeff}} [[Category:1983 births]] [[Category:American male comedians]] [[Category:Last Comic Standing contestants]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Kent, Washington]] [[Category:Kentwood High School (Washington) alumni]] [[Category:21st-century American comedians]]
